alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 7:47AM EST until January 14 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Sunday was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.3 feet on 06/02/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.3 Sun 7 am 4.7 4.3 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
